Ingredients.5: 0.25 cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)

Ingredients.8: 2 tablespoons Asian sweet chile sauce (such as Mae Ploy® Sweet Chilli Sauce)

Directions.1: Toss chicken wings with the flour in a large non-porous bowl to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate 60 to 90 minutes.

Directions.2: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Directions.3: Combine butter, hot pepper sauce, chile-garlic sauce, Thai red chile paste, Asian sweet chile sauce, and honey in a small saucepan over low heat. Heat, stirring occasionally, until the butter is melted completely and the sauce is well blended, about 5 minutes; set aside.

Directions.4: Fry the chicken wings in the hot oil until they become golden brown and are no longer pink in the middle, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove the chicken wings to a serving bowl.

Directions.5: Pour the sauce over the chicken wings; stir to coat.
